issue.title: RepeatAttribute
issue.body:
NUnit 2.6 has a RepeatAttribute. It's currently #ifed out of our 3.0 source. We need to decide if we are going to implement it as is or make some changes. People ask for it (sometimes for bad reasons) so I don't think it should be simply dropped.

Current semantics are that the test is run n times or until it fails, whichever comes first. IOW, it has to pass all n times in order to pass.

We have had requests in the past for only repeating the test in the case of failure. IOW, it would be more like a Retry attribute.

Conceivably, we could generalize this to repeating the test up to n times subject to some rules specified in additional arguments. We could expose the options to the user if we liked or we could simply use such a generalized repeat facility as a base class for various attributes.

We also have a request for ThreadedRepeat, which would run the tests n times on different threads. See #5.

I'm marking this issue as status:design. We should first come up with a spec for what we are going to support and then incorporate the result into 3.0.

body: This will be an easy fix once RepeatAttribute is done because it will look a lot like it in the code. Not quite so easy if it's done first.
RepeatAttribute is now done and avaialble as a model for this one.

This should be pretty much the same as RepeatAttribute except that it will return on first pass and fail if ii goes through all the repeats without managing to pass. The code will be quite small so trying to create a common base would be a waste of time. Also, it's likely that Repeat will be enhanced in the future in ways that retry will not, so let's keep them separate.

@agray Can I interest you in this one?

Is this to be addressed in all the nunit.framework-X.0 projects of only one in particular?

Thoughts?

Definitely in all. It shouldn't have any requirements that can't be met on all platforms. You'll need to use conservative coding so it can build under VS2008 for the compact framework but I think you'll find that the RepeatAttribute is already coded that way for a guide.
I have created a new branch for this issue called issue-585 in my fork.  Question:  How does this new branch in my fork find its way back to the main [this] nunit repo?

Once you push your changes up to your branch on GitHub, there should be a
create pull request button at the top of the source on your fork on the web
page.
On Apr 29, 2015 5:19 AM, "Andrew Gray" notifications@github.com wrote:

> I have created a new branch for this issue called issue-585 in my fork.
> Question: How does this new branch in my fork find its way back to the main
> [this] nunit repo?
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/585#issuecomment-97405488.
@agray I haven't seen the pull request. Are you still working on this?
OK. We're just trying to figure out what to put into the second beta next week. We can push this one to the next release.

issue.title: Unused parameter in Console.WriteLine found
issue.body:
CA2241  Provide correct arguments to formatting methods Method 'NUnitTestAgent.Main(string[])' calls 'Console.WriteLine(string, object)' and does not provide a format item for argument "1". The provided format string is: '"Exception in RemoteTestAgent"'   nunit-agent Program.cs  150

https://github.com/nunit/nunit/blob/master/src/NUnitEngine/nunit-agent/Program.cs#L150

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1849690/7631282/7eae397a-fa48-11e4-8453-509dc59f640c.png)

body: @agray Any progress on this? If you have not started, I'd like to free it up for someone else to work on.

Ok, give it to someone else.  Havent been able to crack it yet
